New Hope Youth Center
1719 E HIGH ST,

Re: License #: CI370377212
Investigation#: 2023C0000339
Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth was placed in unwarranted restraints on 3/11/23 and
3/12/23.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2023,
and had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on March
22, 2023. Youth A said she has been in several restraints since
being placed at the facility and cannot remember all of the details
to each restraint. Youth A was able to recall one restraint on
March 11, 2023, for punching Staff 4 in the face. Youth A said
Staff 5 completed the restraint and she did not have any concerns
about the restraint. Youth A said she does not recall any other
restraint the day of March 11, 2023. Youth A said she does recall
being restrained “a few times” on March 12, 2023. Youth A said
she had “broke” into the staff bathroom by kicking the door
repeatedly. Youth A said she was trying to get a computer and
Staff 5 asked her several times to leave the bathroom and she
refused. Youth A said Staff 5 finally restrained her and moved her
out of the bathroom because she was not listening and would not
leave the bathroom as asked. Youth A stated Staff 5 “was just
doing his job”, stating she was not supposed to be in that
bathroom in the first place. Youth A said she had grabbed other
items while in the bathroom including a phone and put it in the
front of her shirt. Youth A said when Staff 5 was moving her out of
the bathroom Staff 6 took the phone out of the front of her shirt.
Youth A said she cannot recall any other youth being around
during any of these restraints. Youth A said she was not hurt
during the restraints.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed face-to-face at the
facility, on March 22, 2023. Youth B and Youth C denied being
witnesses to Youth A’s restraints on March 11, 2023, and March
12, 2023. Youth B and Youth C both stated they have not seen or
had any concerns with Staff 4 or Staff 5 since they have started at
New Hope Youth Center. Youth B stated she believes both Staff 4
and Staff 5 are fair to all youth in the program.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were all interviewed face-to-face at
the facility, on March 22, 2023. None of these three staff were
working on March 11, 2023, or March 12, 2023, therefore did not
witness the restraints with Youth A. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 all
stated they have worked several shifts with Staff 4 and Staff 5 and
do not have any concerns with their interactions with the youth.
Staff 1 noted Youth A can be “a handful” and has had many
restraints throughout her stay at New Hope Youth Center. Staff 2
2

and Staff 3 both noted that Youth A does not like Staff 4 and so
will act out when he is on shift, also noting Youth A has been
frequently restrained over the past six weeks.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April 11,
2023. Staff 4 said he started to work at New Hope Youth Center a
few month ago and it became very clear almost immediately that
Youth A did not like him and would often act out on his shifts. Staff
4 said Youth A has been in many restraints over the past few
months. The restraints tend to “blend together”, stating it was
difficult to remember all the details on what happened on March
11, 2023, and March 12, 2023. Staff 4 said Youth A would
frequently target him and throw objects at him, hit him, kick him,
and pull his hair, one time even pulling a dread out of his head.
Staff 4 said he does recall March 11, 2023, was a day when he
was punched, and Youth A threw many objects at him including
books, decorations, and games. Staff 4 said when Youth A is
upset and directing her anger towards him, he tries to leave the
area if he is able. Staff 4 said he was not able to recall all the
details, or the number of times Youth A was restrained on March
11, 2023. Staff 4 said he did not remember any restraints from
March 12, 2023 specifically, however stated Youth A kicks in the
staff bathroom door frequently and has gotten laptops, phones,
cords, hair combs used for braiding which has a very pointed
metal end on it, and most recently got scissors and held them to
Staff 6’s throat. Staff 4 said he has worked many shifts with Staff 5
and does not have any concerns with his interactions with the
youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April 11,
2023. Staff 5 said he has been rehired at New Hope Youth Center
for the past few months. Staff 5 said he was working both March
11, 2023, and March 12, 2023. Staff 5 said on March 11, 2023,
Youth A was very escalated and was targeting Staff 4. Staff 5 said
Youth A punched Staff 4 in the face and therefore he restrained
Youth A. Staff 5 said Youth A continued to remain escalated after
released and began to throw books, games, house decorations,
and a door from a cabinet she pulled off at Staff 4. Staff 5 said
Staff 4 attempted to leave the room and Youth A continued to go
after him with objects and therefore Staff 5 restrained Youth A a
second time. Staff 5 said Youth A was very escalated and being
physically aggressive towards Staff 4. Staff 5 said on March 12,
2023, Youth A was once again upset due to computer time ending
and she did not want to get off her computer. Staff 5 said Youth A
put her laptop in her sweatpants and walked around the house like
that for a period of time. Staff 5 said Youth A finally sat down and
3

put the laptop next to her on the couch. Staff 5 said Youth A went
into the kitchen to get a snack, leaving the computer on the couch
at which time staff took the computer and put it into the staff
bathroom. Staff 5 said when Youth A returned to the couch and
saw the laptop was gone, she became very upset and began to
kick in the staff bathroom door. Staff 5 said he asked Youth A
several times to stop kicking the door and was standing and
talking to her however she was ignoring all conversation at that
time. Staff 5 said Youth A was able to get the door to open and
went into the staff bathroom and was putting objects in her shirt,
such as cords, braiding comb that has the metal pointed end, and
a phone. Staff 5 said Youth A was threatening to assault staff, and
then tried to barricade herself in the staff bathroom at which time
Staff 5 placed her in a standing upper torso and walked about two
steps out of the staff bathroom, let her go and shut the staff
bathroom door. Staff 5 said he had asked Youth A several times
to leave the bathroom prior to the restraint. Staff 5 said several
minutes later Youth A once again began to kick the staff bathroom
door until she was able to get in. Staff 5 said he was asking Youth
A to leave the bathroom and she began to take objects from the
staff bathroom including a phone, scissors, hygiene products and
put them in her clothing. Staff 5 said Youth A then began to
barricade herself in the bathroom again at which time he placed
her in a standing upper torso, walked into the hallway and into the
living room entrance way. Staff 5 said Youth A dropped her weight
and so he moved into a seated kneeling hold while Staff 6
retrieved all items Youth A had taken from the staff bathroom.
Staff 5 said he had given Youth A many options prior to the
restraints occurring. Staff 5 said the restraints were “textbook”.
Staff 5 said he wrote the incident reports for all four restraints.
Staff 5 said both days were very busy and there was a lot of
paperwork, and he must have missed some of the details in the
incident reports. Staff 5 said he had recently restarted at New
Hope Youth Center when these restraints occurred and therefore,
he was getting back into the routine of incident report writing.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April 11,
2023. Staff 6 said was working on March 12, 2023. Staff 6 said
Youth A has broken into the staff bathroom many times and was
not able to recall specifically what had occurred on March 12,
2023, however stated that Youth A would get into unsafe things
into the bathroom. Staff 6 said Youth A would always grab items
and place them in her pants or shirt. Staff 6 said Youth A has
gotten cords, phones, laptops, a lighter, a fire extinguisher, and
most recently scissors that she held to Staff 6’s neck and was
threatening her. Staff 6 said she could not remember the exact
4

items Youth A took on March 12, 2023. Staff 6 said Youth A has
been restrained many times over the last few months and was not
able to recall the exact details of the restraint on March 12, 2023,
however said if she would have had concerns about the restraint
she would have talked to Administrator. Staff 6 said she has
worked several shifts with Staff 4 and Staff 5 and does not have
concerns about their interactions with youth.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on, April 17, 2023. Staff
7 said she worked on March 11, 2023, however reported Youth A
has had so many restraints so does not recall the events from that
day specifically. Staff 7 said overall Youth A was vocal about not
liking Staff 4 and Staff 4 did his best to keep his interactions to a
minimum. Staff 7 said Youth A would continue to seek Staff 4 out
and be very assaultive towards him. Staff 7 said Youth A would
kick in the staff bathroom door on many occasions and would then
grab items such as staff belongings, scissors, hand soap, cords
from chargers for laptops, and facility phone. Staff 7 said Youth A
would frequently try to use items or her body to barricade herself
into the bathroom. Staff 7 said she has worked many shifts with
Staff 4 and Staff 5 and has never seen them go into a restraint
that did not pose safety issues. Staff 7 said she has witnessed
both Staff 4 and Staff 5 get hit by the youth and still not enter into
a restraint. Staff 7 said everyone is trained not to restrain youth
until there is an immediate risk of harm to self or others.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on,
March 22, 2023. Administrator said the camera’s only hold
footage for seven days and the footage for March 11, 2023, and
March 12, 2023, was not saved. Administrator said she knows
both Staff 4 and Staff 5 were trained not to restrain unless there is
an immediate risk of harm to youth or others. Administrator said
she did briefly discuss the restraints with Staff 5 and he had
additional information that was missing from the incident reports.
Documents reviewed.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 4 completed SCM training on February 28, 2023.
• Staff 5’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 5 completed SCM training on August 22, 2022.
• Incident Report 150940202 dated March 11, 2023. The
incident report describes the restraint that Staff 5
completed due to Youth A punching Staff 4. The incident
report then describes Staff 5 restraining Youth A for her
“attempting to throw a notebook” at Staff 4. Additional
5

details described in Staff 5’s interview was not included in
the incident report.
• Incident Report 150940204 dated March 12, 2023. The
incident report describes Staff 5 restraining Youth A on two
separate occasions due to her being in the staff bathroom.
The additional details provided in Staff 5’s interview about
Youth A’s unsafe behaviors were not documented in the
incident report.
• New Hope Youth Center Safe Crisis Management (SCM)
and Physical intervention policy and procedure. The policy
clearly outlines “The use of emergency restraint as a
lifesaving response for a youth”.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Emergency Restraint.
Youth and Staff interviews provided additional details regarding
the restraints that were not included in the original incident report
which justified the use of restraint with Youth A in order to keep
her and other safe.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed in two restraints on 3/11/23 and only one
incident report was written. Youth was placed in two restraints on
3/12/23 and only one incident report was written.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2023,
and had no further information.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April 11,
2023. Staff 5 said he completed one incident report for Youth A’s
two restraints from March 11, 2023. Staff 5 said he completed one
incident report for Youth A’s two restraints from March 12, 2023.
Staff 5 said he was not aware that each restraint needed a
separate incident report, and he viewed them as “one episode”
since she was dysregulated from prior to the first restraint until
after the second restraint.
6

Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on,
March 22, 2023. Administrator said she was not aware that the
facility needed to complete separate incident reports for each
restraint if they were back-to-back during the same “episode”.
Administrator noted that going forward she will ensure incident
reports are completed separately.
• New Hope Youth Center Incident Reporting Policy and
Procedure. The document outlines when an incident report
is required to be written which includes “Use of Physical
Interventions (restraint/seclusion)”. The policy does not
specifically address that each restraint needs to be
completed on separated documents.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with incident reporting. The
facility did not complete separate incident reports for Youth A’s
restraints.
Technical Assistance
Agency needs to remind staff to provide a detail description in
incident report of what occurred leading up to a restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the that
the current license status be continued.
